content.p: Are you looking for a career where you can make a difference every day? Where you'll provide essential care to mothers throughout their pregnancy, birth, and early parenthood? Our Midwifery BSc course provides a supportive midwifery community, where we’ll help you on your journey to becoming a competent, compassionate and caring midwife. You'll be equipped with the knowledge, practical, interpersonal and leadership skills essential for this role. You’ll work closely with women and their families, accompanying them through all the stages of pregnancy, childbirth, and beyond. Clinical placements play a vital role in your development as a midwife, providing invaluable opportunities to refine your midwifery skills in real-world settings. Throughout your journey, you'll follow the pregnancy journeys of numerous women, fostering continuity of care through your case-holding experience. Accredited by the UNICEF Baby Friendly Initiative (BFI), highlighting our commitment to providing quality maternal and infant care. Nursing and Midwifery Council (NMC) registration: graduating from our course qualifies you for NMC registration, enabling you to practice as a professional midwife. Clinical focus: follow women throughout the entire journey of pregnancy, birth, and postpartum, gaining practical skills and clinical knowledge from the very beginning of your studies. Hands-on learning in a major UK hospital: learn in an active healthcare environment, gaining practical experience from day one. Placement opportunities: gain valuable experience through a range of placements, including expanding your experience and career prospects. A day in the life of a midwifery student Camille
